title: [Skin Concept] Jackelope Gnar
body:
Just wanted to share an idea for a skin for Gnar. Basing him on the mythical Jackelope would be a great fir for his theme and his bouncy animations already complement the idea. In addition, his Mega Gnar form could give him some full heavier antlers like a moose. I am not a competent artist, but here is a picture of a Jackelope that already looks like Gnar.
via Pardoart @Deviantart
http://fc02.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2014/050/c/8/jackalope_by_pardoart-d7741eh.jpg
Full photo credit here: http://pardoart.deviantart.com/
Cheers, Summoners! :)

Edit: added art link.

replies.body: O___O OMGosh. Just when I thought Gnar couldn't get any cuter.
If you're not, send this to the skins team asap!
Maybe a SnowDown skin? He could be dressed like a reindeer or something like Kog'Maws.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=tEff2nZN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-01-26T00:50:16.050+0000)
>
> O___O OMGosh. Just when I thought Gnar couldn't get any cuter.

pls say that after he becomes MegaGnar
Haha dark. But I can't argue with Witcher!

mega Gnar would be so cool though, he'd have huge horns like a ram, maybe wide enough that R becomes a huge head butt. Wallop could be him slamming his front hooves into the ground, and Crunch just fits because goats/ rams have some serious hops
I'm sorry it's cute, but not gnar enough. Gnar is still a hunter at heart. I want to see a yordle team skin with him in it. Also it be cool to have a skin with him and rengar for their lore.
Night Hunter Gnar has a good ring to it, tbh.
I think it would be a great idea, because he is still not a part of any other themed skins yet. Also everyone look Void Gnar in the boards and get support behind it. The artwork looks amazing.
FFFF, this is too much cute to bear!
PLZ RITOS OMG SO CUTE AND KAWAIIIIII
So cute you just have to say it twice in different languages... weab
AT least he doesn't look like a run-down street cat or one that got stuck in a dinosaur costume
The last thing many a half-eaten beef cow or dismembered rancher has ever seen out in the wide open prairie on a calm summer night...
